intro: Pholidota longilabra, commonly known as the long-stemmed pholidota, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent corona. Pholidota longilabra is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
